squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx

Class AnimatedPNG

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx.AnimatedPNG
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable

    public class AnimatedPNG
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
    Animated full-color (with full alpha) PNG encoder with compression. An instance can be reused to encode multiple animated PNGs with minimal allocation. If you are only using a small number of colors (256 or less), you can use PNG8.write(FileHandle, Array, int) to write an indexed-color animated PNG instead, which should have a smaller file size. The full-color, full-alpha animated images can look like this.

    • Method Detail

      • setFlipY

        public void setFlipY(boolean flipY)
        If true, the resulting AnimatedPNG is flipped vertically. Default is true.

      • setCompression

        public void setCompression(int level)
        Sets the deflate compression level. Default is Deflater.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION.

      • write

        public void write(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an animated PNG file consisting of the given frames to the given file, at 60 frames per second.
        Parameters:
        file - the file location to write to; any existing file with this name will be overwritten
        frames - an Array of Pixmap frames to write in order to the animated PNG
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • write

        public void write(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames,
                  int fps)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an animated PNG file consisting of the given frames to the given file, at fps frames per second.
        Parameters:
        file - the file location to write to; any existing file with this name will be overwritten
        frames - an Array of Pixmap frames to write in order to the animated PNG
        fps - how many frames per second the animated PNG should display
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • write

        public void write(java.io.OutputStream output,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames,
                  int fps)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes animated PNG data consisting of the given frames to the given output stream without closing the stream, at fps frames per second.
        Parameters:
        output - the stream to write to; the stream will not be closed
        frames - an Array of Pixmap frames to write in order to the animated PNG
        fps - how many frames per second the animated PNG should display
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposal should probably be done explicitly, especially if using JRE versions after 8. In Java 8 and earlier, you could rely on finalize() doing what this does, but that isn't a safe assumption in Java 9 and later. Note, don't use the same AnimatedPNG object after you call this method; you'll need to make a new one if you need to write again after disposing.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
